premises: If a rock contains fossils, then it is sedimentary
The rock does not contain fossils
incorrect conclusions: The rock contains fossils and it is sedimentary
If a rock is sedimentary, then it contains fossils
If a rock does not contain fossils, then it is sedimentary
If a rock is not sedimentary, then it does not contain fossils

premises: If a mineral scratches glass, then it is harder than glass
The mineral does not scratch glass
conclusions: The mineral is not harder than glass
incorrect conclusions: The mineral scratches glass and it is harder than glass
If a mineral is harder than glass, then it scratches glass
If a mineral does not scratch glass, then it is harder than glass
If a mineral is not harder than glass, then it does not scratch glass

premises: If an earthquake occurs, then tectonic plates have moved
incorrect conclusions: An earthquake occurred and tectonic plates have moved
If tectonic plates have moved, then an earthquake occurs
If tectonic plates have not moved, then an earthquake occurs
If an earthquake did not occur, then tectonic plates have not moved
